intro: Meloneura purpurea, commonly known as the purple meloneura, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often clustered in umbels, and the plant is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Meloneura purpurea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
